children.subject: TA is another term for GSI (Graduate Student Instructor you also see the term uGSI for Undergraduate Student Instructors). All these roles are paid, GSI/uGSI get part to all of their tuition paid on top of their salary. You must have taken the course to apply for these positions. If you apply for a GSI position CSM experience is helpful.

history.content:
Take a look through the pages here for more detailed info about the different positions. All 3 positions are paid (you can find the current rates here), but uGSIs additionally have part of their tuition paid for too, which is called fee remission. 

TA/uGSI/GSI: These are the staff that hold discussion sections, run Piazza, hold office hours, write exams, build course infrastructure, etc etc. 

Reader: Readers are mostly responsible for grading homework, projects, exams, etc (though TA's also help grade exams). I believe some courses have readers hold office hours too. 

Tutor: Tutors are mostly responsible for tutoring current students, either individually or in small groups. I believe tutors are only hired for 61ABC and 16AB. For these courses there's usually a Piazza post that goes up at the beginning of the semester like "Hey, sign up for individual / small-group tutoring for this class!" and students sign up for sections and tutors are responsible for teaching those weekly sections. (Like paid CSM.) I believe tutors also hold office hours. 

The requirements to apply are in the first page I linked. Hope this helps (and anyone else please correct me / add on!)

children.subject: Readers usually grade homework/exams and help out in office hours, tutors lead small sections going over material in the class
What's the difference between tutor and reader? They both seem to be 8 hours.

history.content: I'm a freshman so I have no clue what these different positions are or how the entire process works. What are the different positions(reader,TA, tutor, GSI) and what roles do they each entail? Do you get paid for these positions? Do you have to have taken the course to apply for these positions? Are there any special requirements to apply?
history.subject: Question about TA positions
